title: Liverpool defender Andy Robertson hails 'top professional' Adam Lallana after late goal at Man Utd
text:
Liverpool defender Andy Robertson has hailed Adam Lallana for being a 'top professional' after his late goal rescued a point at Manchester United.

The England midfielder has been forced to watch on from the sidelines over the last year, having struggled with repetitive injuries.

Despite being restricted to cameo appearances, Robertson revealed that Lallana is a key figure in the dressing room.

Adam Lallana has had little game time but rescued a late point at Man United on Sunday

The Scotsman provided the cross for Lallana to tap into the net to secure a point after Marcus Rashford's opener and admitted he was over the moon for his team-mate.

'Adam feels it as well because you can see when he is injured,' he told the club's official website.

'Nobody likes it when you are injured, but he managed to pick himself up, he is now fit and he has been unbelievable this season in training. He has been giving 100 per cent.

Andy Robertson (R) hailed 'top professional' Lallana after Sunday's draw at Old Trafford

'In the changing rooms before games he is one of the loudest. He could easily be quiet as he is on the bench and not playing. But the way he has conducted himself - and, to be fair, [along with] all of the lads who haven't played as much as they would have wanted - Adam is a top, top professional and a top, top guy.

'I'm absolutely delighted for him that he could get on the end of it.'

The 25-year-old is backing the midfielder to push on after an impressive 20-minute display against United.

He added: 'When he came on I thought he was brilliant and I thought he changed the game. To get that goal, it will do a world of good for him and his confidence and I think we'll see a lot more from him.'
description: The England midfielder has been forced to watch on from the sidelines over the last year, having struggled with repetitive injuries. He came off the bench on Sunday and scored a late eqauliser.
